name: M Movies Trivia Game | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which 1964 movie, starring Audrey Hepburn and Rex Harrison, is an adaption of George Bernard Shaw's play "Pygmalion"?
questions.explanation:
My Fair Lady.

	Henry Higgins (Harrison) bets that with his language skills, he can so transform a common flower girl that she will pass as a high society woman.  After a rocky start, and some memorable songs, Henry and the flower girl, Eliza Doolittle (Hepburn), realise that they are meant for one another. Marni Nixon who actually sang most of the songs for the character Eliza Doolittle in "My Fair Lady", also provided her voice for Natalie Wood in "West Side Story" and Deborah Kerr in both "An Affair to Remember" and "The King and I".

questions.text: Toni Collette plays a girl obsessed with both marriage and ABBA in which 1994 Australian movie?
questions.explanation:
Muriel's Wedding.

	Muriel Heslop (Collette) did not have the best start to life. She is overweight, grew up in a town named Porpoise Spit, and has a dysfunctional family. When Muriel steals some money and heads off on a tropical holiday, she runs into Rhonda Epinstalk (Rachel Griffiths) and sets off to Sydney to change her life. Toni Collette gained 18 kilograms (40 pounds) to play the role of Muriel.

questions.text: Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones wear some rather spiffy suits in which movie released in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Men in Black.

	James Edwards (Smith) is a regular New York Police officer until one day he encounters an alien and is drawn into the world of the secretive organisation known as the MIB. With a change of name to Agent J, he partners with the experienced Agent K (Jones), and together they are on a mission to save the galaxy. "Men in Black" is based on the comic book series of the same name by Lowell Cunningham.

questions.text: Christina Ricci's first film role is in which 1990 movie, also starring Cher and Winona Ryder?
questions.explanation:
Mermaids.

	Rachel Flax (Cher) moves to a small town with her two daughters Charlotte (Ryder) and Kate (Ricci). While Kate is content just to concentrate on becoming the world's greatest swimmer, Rachel and Charlotte make quite an impression on the men of the town, and their lives, of course, are changed forever. Christina Ricci was only 10 years old when the movie was released.

questions.text: Sandra Bullock plays an FBI agent desperately in need of a makeover in which 2000 movie?
questions.explanation:
Miss Congeniality.

	At first glance Gracie Hart (Bullock) would not be anybody's first pick as a beauty pageant contestant, but when the FBI need an undercover agent to infiltrate the Miss United States beauty pageant she is allocated the job.  With the help of expert Victor Melling (Michael Caine) Gracie attempts to convince the judges that she is indeed beautiful, talented and graceful enough to be the next Miss United States. Michael Caine was born Maurice Micklewhite, and took the name Caine from the 1951 Pulitzer prize winning novel (and 1954 film) "The Caine Mutiny".

questions.text: Dick Van Dyke attempts a Cockney accent to play odd-jobs man Bert in which 1964 musical?
questions.explanation:
Mary Poppins.

	When the Banks children need a new nanny, Mary Poppins (Julie Andrews) flies down on her magical umbrella and brings music and cheer to their previously strict lives. "Mary Poppins" is the only film nominated for a Best Picture Oscar that was personally produced by Walt Disney.

questions.text: Which 2000 film with a non-linear story line, depicts a man with anterograde amnesia trying to find the killer of his wife?
questions.explanation:
Memento.

	Leonard (Guy Pearce) is unable to make new memories following a head injury he sustained during his wife's murder. Despite this, Leonard is determined to hunt down his wife's killer. He uses numerous methods to remember clues leading to the killer's identity, including taking Polaroid photographs and tattooing clues onto his own body. "Memento" effectively blends two different narratives to tell its story, using black and white film for the narrative running in chronological order, and colour film for the narrative running in reverse chronological order. The two narratives blend in the final scenes. Sound confusing? If you own this movie on DVD and are thoroughly confused, you can cheat and watch the coloured scenes backwards (so they are in chronological order).

questions.text: Australian pop-princess Kylie Minogue makes a cameo appearance as the Green Fairy in which 2001 film by Baz Luhrmann?
questions.explanation:
Moulin Rouge!.

	Christian (Ewan McGregor) a young Bohemian falls in love with Moulin Rouge's star courtesan Satine (Nicole Kidman). Unfortunately the club's patron, known as the Duke (Richard Roxburgh) desires Satine for himself. The two young lovers secretly carry out a doomed affair under the Duke's nose. Moulin rouge is French for red windmill.

questions.text: After a bitter divorce, Daniel Hillard dresses up as a female housekeeper in order to see his children in which 1993 movie?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Doubtfire

	After his wife Miranda (Sally Field) gets custody of their children, out of work children's performer Daniel (Robin Williams) enlists the aid of his make-up artist friend to transform him into Mrs. Doubtfire. As Mrs.Doubtfire he is able to see his children and also make an attempt to put a spanner in the works of Miranda's budding relationship with Stuart Dunmeyer (Pierce Brosnan). "Mrs. Doubtfire" is based on Anne Fine's novel "Alias Madame Doubtfire".

questions.text: In which 1997 movie does Julia Roberts' character set out to break up the wedding of her long time best friend to the character played by Cameron Diaz?
questions.explanation:
My Best Friend's Wedding.

	When Jules (Roberts) discovers that her best friend Michael (Dermot Mulroney) is about to get married, she realises that she is in love with him herself.  Jules sets off to Chicago in an attempt to sabotage the wedding, but is instead roped into becoming his fiancée's maid of honour. With the help of her gay friend George (Rupert Everett), Jules plots to destroy the relationship while attending to her maid of honor duties. Ronald Bass the writer of "My Best Friend's Wedding" went on to work with Julia Roberts again a year later when he wrote the screenplay for "Stepmon".
